revised_title: Francis Leslie Rose: A Pioneering Chemist and Educator
tldr: This biographical memoir recounts the life and achievements of Francis Leslie Rose, a prominent chemist and educator. Born in Lincoln in 1909, Rose was passionate about science from a young age, thanks to his family's support and encouragement. He went on to study at Lincoln City School and later won a scholarship to the City School, where he excelled in chemistry and physics. Rose's early experiments and education laid the foundation for his future career, which included work in organometallic chemistry and contributions to the chemical industry. His dedication to education and science earned him a place among the Fellows of the Royal Society.
